Participating Theatres

Discover the prestigious theatres from across the Balkans that make Acting Europe a celebration of regional theatrical excellence and cultural exchange.

Kyustendil, Bulgaria
Drama Theatre "Krum Kyulyavkov"
Founded in 1952

A prominent regional theatre known for its innovative productions and commitment to Bulgarian dramatic arts.

Sofia, Bulgaria
"Ivan Vazov" National Theatre
Founded in 1904

Bulgaria's oldest and most prestigious theatre, serving as the national stage for dramatic arts.

Plovdiv, Bulgaria
"N. O. Masalitinov" Plovdiv Drama Theatre
Founded in 1881

One of Bulgaria's leading regional theatres, known for its diverse repertoire and artistic excellence.

Veles, North Macedonia
"Jordan Hadzi Konstantinov - Dzinot" Drama Theatre
Founded in 1945

A distinguished theatre company from Veles, continuing the legacy of theatrical excellence in North Macedonia.

Belgrade, Serbia
National Theatre
Founded in 1868

Serbia's premier theatrical institution, renowned for its classical and contemporary productions.

Skopje, North Macedonia
Macedonian National Theatre
Founded in 1947

The leading theatrical institution of North Macedonia, showcasing the rich cultural heritage of the region.

Cultural Exchange Through Theatre

Acting Europe brings together these distinguished theatres to create a unique platform for cultural dialogue and artistic collaboration. Each participating theatre contributes its unique perspective, creating a rich tapestry of Balkan theatrical traditions and contemporary innovations.

Acting Europe

Theatre Without Borders - International theatre festival celebrating cultural exchange and artistic collaboration.
